instruction: Provide an example of a unethical promotional tactic.
output: An example of unethical promotional tactics is lying to customers in product advertisements. This includes fabricating or exaggerating product features in order to gain an unfair advantage over competitors. For example, claiming a product has capabilities that it actually does not or distorting the facts about a product in order to make it seem more impressive than it is. Such behavior is unethical and can damage customers' trust in the brand.
